# Tag Taxonomy

Prefer these existing tags unless there's a strong reason to add a new one.

## Notes Tags

- `2026` — predictions/outlook content anchored in 2026
- `ai` — general AI topics
- `ai-agents` — autonomous AI agents
- `ai-governance` — AI governance, policy, risk
- `ai-tools` — AI tooling, integrations
- `astro` — Astro framework
- `automation` — workflow automation
- `chatgpt` — ChatGPT-specific
- `enterprise-architecture` — EA topics
- `ios` — iOS/Apple
- `iphone-shortcuts` — Shortcuts app
- `klondike` — Klondike project
- `llm` — large language models
- `productivity` — productivity tips
- `security` — security topics
- `sovereign-ai` — sovereign AI
- `windows` — Windows OS
- `workflow` — workflow/process

## Recipe Tags

- `recipes` — general recipe marker (required for all recipes)
- `condiments` — sauces, spreads, dressings
- `danish-food` — Danish cuisine
- `sandwiches` — sandwich-related dishes

## Tag Rules

- Use 2–6 tags per note or recipe
- Prefer topical tags (`ai`, `enterprise-architecture`, `danish-food`) plus 1–2 context tags (`workflow`, `productivity`, `sandwiches`)
- All tags must be lowercase kebab-case
- Don't create near-duplicates
- Recipes should always include `recipes` tag plus cuisine/category tags

## When to Add New Tags

Add only if:
1. Topic will have multiple future notes/recipes
2. No existing tag reasonably covers it

Keep new tags short and broad enough to reuse.
